justification: The article mentions using the Berlin Numeracy Test (BNT) to measure participants' statistical numeracy, which forms a part of objective numeracy.
Participants' subjective numeracy was assessed using the eight-item Subjective Numeracy Scale, which evaluates their confidence in performing numerical tasks.
Math anxiety was measured using the Math Anxiety Questionnaire for Adults (MAQA), which assesses the levels of anxiety related to numerical tasks.
The negative component of the BERRI scale was used to measure participants' affect negativity during the lottery task after the presentation of visual aids.
